greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest positive number k such that 2^k contains n.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Popular Computing (Calabasas, CA), Two Tables, Vol. 1, (No. 9, Dec 1973), page PC9-16.
mathematica: a = {}; Do[k = 1; While[ StringPosition[ ToString[2^k], ToString[n] ] == {}, k++ ]; a = Append[a, k], {n, 0, 50} ]; a
xref: Apart from initial term, a duplicate of A030000.
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 10 2001
